newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices fall on low expectations.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices fall on low expectations.

text.p: Indian cotton prices suffered a setback on Wednesday on slow mill buying and the absence of an expected announcement by the government regarding more cotton exports, dealers said.
In spot deals Bengal-deshi fell by 15 rupees at 895/950 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned moved down by 30/50 rupees to 1,480/1,625 rupees per maund.
Gujarat Kalyan (medium-staple) lost earlier gains by 200/300 rupees to 12,200/12,500 rupees per candy (355.56 kg).

"Earlier in the week the market remained firm on speculative buying amid expectations that the government may allow more exports but delays regarding an announcement of more exports has capped a rally today," one broker said.
"Renewed offerings by the state-owned agencies also dragged prices down," he added.
